articles.title: SoftBank to Invest $2 Billion in Intel as Part of US Push - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: SoftBank Group Corp. agreed to buy $2 billion of Intel Corp. stock, a surprise deal to shore up a struggling US name while boosting its own chip ambitions.

articles.title: Stock futures ticked down as the market awaits Fed's Jackson Hole summit, retail earnings: Live updates - CNBC
articles.description: Investors are awaiting clues from Fed Chair Jerome Powell as to what will happen at the central bank's remaining policy meetings this year.

articles.title: Air Canada and flight attendants union resume talks for the first time since strike began - CNN
articles.description: Air Canada and the union representing 10,000 flight attendants resumed talks late Monday for the first time since the strike began over the weekend. The strike is affecting about 130,000 travelers a day at the peak of the summer travel season.

articles.title: Asian Stocks Look Subdued Ahead of Jackson Hole: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg
articles.description: Financial markets moved in narrow ranges, with global equities holding near record highs, after Donald Trump’s meeting with Ukraine’s president and European leaders ended with a call for a summit with Russia.

articles.title: Tesla Launches Six-Seat Model Y L In China For $47,180 - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Tesla has launched the six-seat Model Y L in China, starting at RMB 339,000 ($47,180).

articles.title: Asia Morning Briefing: Traders Tilt Bearish on August BTC, ETH Targets as Retail Lags Institutions - CoinDesk
articles.description: Prediction markets are flashing red even as institutions keep doubling down on BTC and ETH.

articles.title: FTC Sues Ticket Resale Company, Alleging Eras Tour Price Gouging Scheme - The Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: The agency sued Maryland-based Key Investment Group, alleging that the company violated the BOTS Act to obtain thousands of Eras Tour tickets and resell them for millions of dollars.

articles.title: Over-the-counter birth control pills have been available in the US for over a year. Here’s who’s using them - CNN
articles.description: About two years after the US Food and Drug Administration approved the first over-the-counter birth control pill in the United States, a new study suggests that many people who may not have had access to contraception before are now using the over-the-counter…

articles.title: Exclusive | TV-Station Owner Sinclair Proposes Merger With Tegna - The Wall Street Journal
Kroger to close Fred Meyer grocery stores in Kent, Everett - KOMO
articles.description: Two Fred Meyer stores are closing permanently in western Washington in mid-October.

articles.title: Allianz Life data breach affects 1.1 million customers - TechCrunch
articles.description: Data breach notification site Have I Been Pwned notified 1.1 million customers of a July data breach, a number not previously reported.

articles.title: For kids with Barth syndrome, time is running out, parents say, unless the FDA acts - NBC News
articles.description: The drug Elamipretide from Stealth BioTherapeutics treats an ultrarare, fatal disease called Barth syndrome. Small studies say it's safe and effective. But the FDA denied approval, leaving children with few options.

articles.title: Palo Alto Stock Leaps After Earnings. Guidance Was Upbeat. - Barron's
Major Calif. food processing factory closing, leaving state after 78 years - SFGATE
articles.description: The owner of Spreckels Sugar Company in the Imperial Valley announced plans to close the decades-old factory, ending sugar beet farming in California.

articles.title: Sam Altman Says There’s an AI Bubble. What Wall Street Thinks. - Barron's
When could tariff-driven price increases hit shoppers? Experts explain - ABC News
MTA to begin digging 2nd Ave. subway in East Harlem, 50 years after project halted - Gothamist
articles.description: The transit agency inked a nearly $2 billion contract on Monday to begin major construction work on a subway line that's been floated for a century.

articles.title: What to Expect from Fed Chair Powell's Speech on Friday: 3 Key Scenarios - Investopedia
articles.description: Wall Street will be listening closely to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech Friday at the Jackson Hole economic policy summit, where he could signal whether the central bank is ready to cut borrowing costs at its next meeting in September.

articles.title: UnitedHealth Got a Boost From Berkshire’s Buying. 2 Reasons to Wait to Follow. - Barron's
